definition[0]: how much a car of a particular age, style etc should be worth if you sold it
definition[1]: the value of a business after you sell all of its assets and pay all of its debts
definition[2]: the value of something that a company owns, which it lists in its accounts
definition[3]: the value of an asset or group of assets in a company’s accounts, not necessarily the amount they could be sold for
example[0]: The company owns a ski resort on Lake Tahoe that could be worth double its $19 million book value.
definition[4]: the value of a company measured as its total assets minus total liabilities except liabilities to shareholders
example[1]: Value investors buy a stock when it seems cheap compared with a company’s earnings, dividends, or book value.
